qas.question: What is the best for an recieving antenna for optimum reception?
What is used to match vertical and horizontal linear polarizations?
A transmission can cause reduction in what?

context: It is best for the receiving antenna to <a0_0>match the polarization<a0_0/> of the transmitted wave for optimum reception. <a1_0>Intermediate matchings<a1_0/> will lose some signal strength, but not as much as a complete mismatch. A <a2_0>circularly polarized<a2_0/> antenna can be used to equally well match vertical or horizontal linear polarizations. Transmission from a circularly polarized antenna received by a linearly polarized antenna (or vice versa) entails a 3 dB reduction in <a3_0>signal-to-noise ratio<a3_0/> as the received power has thereby been cut in half.
